snippet: Why couldn’t the housing authority train tenants to do basic maintenance, and pay them for it?
abstract: Op-Ed article by author Jayne Merkel proposes solution to repair and upgrade crisis in New York City's public housing, which has reached an $18 billion backlog over 10 years due to budget cuts; suggests New York City Housing Authority could train tenants to do basic maintenance and pay them for it, reducing backlog and ameliorating unemployment.
lead_paragraph: Why couldn’t the housing authority train tenants to do basic maintenance, and pay them for it?
